headline: Chef John's Smothered Pork Chops
description: Chef John's smothered pork chops recipe is an easy yet delicious combination of dark, rich onion gravy covering tender, pan-fried pork chops.

video.description: See how to make simple pork chops smothered in deliciousness.
video.name: Chef John's Smothered Pork Chops

name: Chef John's Smothered Pork Chops
recipeIngredient: 4 large bone-in pork chops, about 1 inch thick
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle pork chops with poultry seasoning, salt, and black pepper on both sides. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; brown pork chops well on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.

Discard excess grease from the pan and melt butter in the same skillet. Reduce heat to medium and stir onion in the hot skillet with a pinch of salt until onion is very browned and caramelized, about 15 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in flour and cook for 2 minutes.

Pour chicken broth into the skillet and stir, dissolving browned bits of food in the bottom of the skillet. Pour juices that have accumulated on the plate containing pork chops into the sauce. Mix in buttermilk until smooth. Add water. Bring sauce to a simmer, reduce heat to low, and cook until onions begin to break down and sauce is thickened, 15 to 20 minutes.

Place pork chops into sauce, spooning sauce over meat to coat. Turn heat to low and simmer until chops are tender and cooked through, about 10 minutes. Adjust levels of salt and pepper and serve chops with gravy on top.

review.reviewBody: Excellent recipe! Easy, but does take a little bit of time. I would use 2 onions next time. Used sour cream instead of buttermilk.
I loved this dish! I'm new to cooking but this turned out great! Will definitely be making this again.
Excellent and easy. I used half & half instead of buttermilk because that's what I had other than that made as written. Served over egg noodles. The gravy is awesome.
Absolutely great recipe! Made minor adjustments for our families taste, added cream/butter/chives. They licked their plates clean and sopped up the rest with Italian bread.
I loved these cooked this way. Gravy was not overwhelming at all. It was perfect! I am making them again tonight.
The onions were so sweet. Totally amazing, will be making again for sure. Went well with mashed potatoes and green beans. Used 2 onions.
delish! with some sweet mashed potatoes or even regular creamy mashies with green beans!

I made this for dinner. My husband just kept saying "this is great". The only thing I did different was I doubled the sauce and substituted Garlic Parmesan Sauce for the whipped cream. Next time I make it I am going to add some Baby Bella Mushrooms to the sauce and more onions. YUM!

This was great. Easy overall. Good winter dish. I didn't have buttermilk or milk to make buttermilk so I used sour cream as others have done. Followed all of the instructions other than I added mushrooms when onions were about 75% done. Cozy dish. Served over mashed potatoes.

Seriously one of my favorite recipes. The first time I made it, I was a little annoyed that the directions didn't recommend tempering the buttermilk with the sauce because it curdled. However, by the time the sauce was done, so were the curds. One tip I would add is to add 1/8- 1/4 tsp of baking soda to the onions to help them caramelize much faster. In any case, my kitchen smells like ranch. Time to eat!
The chicken broth made it salty Next time low sodium broth Yet outcome looked nice over rice
Followed exactly! Didn't taste good, took way longer than necessary and my kitchen may smell like onions forever. Very disappointed.
no buttermilk used low fat sourcreme.... perfect
Made as Chef John directed, it was mouth-watering its now on my monthly rotation list, thanksJohn another winner
Loved it. Great recipe. Full of flavor. It was a hit. Thank you for a great recipe.
Everyone loved it! Easy to make and would work well with pretty much any white meat. Adding this to my favorites list.
This recipe was a home run with the family. I recommend it!
I made it exactly how you said and it turned out excellent. Thank you so much for the recipe.

Made this as written except dusted chops with flour before frying. Sauce wasn't as thick as i had hoped, I will try to figure that out next time i make this because the flavor was amazing!!! Served over Egg noodles, will try rice next time too. Ok made this again and this time I still floured the chops browned them but added more onions, added ground thyme and subbed sour cream for the buttermilk and the gravy was thicker and amazing over basmatic rice!!! YUMMY

Delicious. I didn't cook it quite enough for my taste, but the rest of the family thought it was not underdone; I ended up zapping mine 30 seconds. I didn't have buttermilk and didn't want to use the milk + vinegar trick, so I substituted cream mexicana (basically sour cream but with a bit more tang.) Probably made it thicker, but it wasn't too thick. Delicious.
Tasty easy fast make recipe
Simply Delicious!! One of my fav ways to eat Porkchops...
I don't often give 5 stars for a recipe without changing something. This recipe is perfect in every way. Delicious!!
Made this dish for my family. I got to say this is the most delicious smothered pork chops I've ever tasted. Definitely will be making this again.
I love this recipe, my hubby did too! I had trouble getting my chops moist, and with this recipe my chops were delicious, and moist. Didn’t have buttermilk, and used 1/2 &1/2.
Great stuff just added a pack of goya
This recipe was so freaking delicious! My new favorite pork chop recipe.
No changes. Excellent
Excellent. I didn't have poultry seasoning ...used Montreal and Natures Seasoning. Didn't have butter milk used sour cream. Super good.
Excellent. I used a little milk instead of buttermilk because I didn't have any. It worked fine.
Excellent! I think I would add additional seasoning to the pork before frying. I love garlic, and I think it needs a little more. My husband said this recipe needs to be on the saved list!
Wasnt as good as the reviews were claiming. Definitely need more time cooking the pork chops.
Little too much water so I used cornstarch to thicken lightly.
Easy recipe and delicious!
taste great!!!
Great recipe, but be careful with broth. I found it a little too salty
Fantastic recipe! Be sure to take the other folks advice and caramelize the onions. Definite keeper!

This dinner was awesome. A little salty ( my fault - not recipe) so if your on a low sodium diet watch how much you use. 
Giving it 5 stars, will definitely make this again.
Excellent!!!!

Great recipe. Did not have buttermilk, but used another reviewer's suggestion and used a little sour cream. Very popular with my family. Have also used the same the same recipe and substituted chicken for the pork chops. Works just as well with chicken.
This was easy and delicious. Next time I make it I would like to try it with pork tenderloin medallions because I think it will be better to use meat without a bone.
This recipe was awesome. I will make it again. Chef John's recipes so far are really good.
I just made this and my husband was happy. I added my own spices and some yellow peppers with the onions but otherwise I followed the recipe.

Didn’t have poultry seasoning, so made it. Didn’t have buttermilk, so used milk with a little vinegar in it. It came out so tender and tasty; we just loved it. Added a few carrots, and had a baked potato with it, with some of the gravy on top. 
I plan to make it when we get together with my family. They will be impressed by the good meal from the not-so—good cook in the family Also not too difficult For me
Wonderful flavor. Just perfect! Thanks Chef John.

This is a great recipe Chef John. I prepared as directed, however, I cooked them in the crockpot on high for 1hr. 45mins. At the end, I added a tad bit more gravy (I mixed 1 cup of the juices from the crock pot and about a 1/4 cup more of flour to thicken. The pork chops turned out super tender and not dried out at all and full of flavor. My family loved it. Thank you!
Flavor of chops was good. They were a little tougher than we like but very good. Gravy was delicious, just wish there would have been more.

The gravy and rice were superb!
I cook most nights and love trying new recipes, or rethinking traditional classics. You can never go wrong with any Chef John recipe, and this one does not disappoint!
It is surprisingly delicious for being such a simple and easy recipe.

While the pork chops were juicy, the whole dish was very bland and very watery. The only deviation I made was to add 2 onions which still weren't enough. I also had to add a cornstarch slurry to tighten up the gravy.
Delicious! I did add some worchestershire sauce for flavor.

I followed this recipe exactly, but added sliced, fresh mushrooms to the last few minutes of sautéing the onions. I was told this was delicious (I don’t eat pork) and that the pork chops were very tender. Thanks for posting this great recipe!
I made the recipe as it was written. Great comfort food on a cold night. served over rice to soak up the rich gravy,

I am not one who enjoys cooking but will try something every so often when I have to cook. Hubby does most of the cooking. I decided to try this because I do not care for pork chops and how dry they tend to me. This was fantastic - had leftovers for lunch today and it was just as delicious. YUMMY!!!!!

next time will add more onions

So very flavorful! The gravy was amazing. This recipe is perfect! This is one of my husbands favorite dishes. I am from the Caribbean so I like my meat with a lot of flavor so I marinated the pork for 48 hours with green seasonings, salt and pepper for a burst of flavor when prepared.
I LOVE THE SAUCE! But will be using Pork Tenderloin in the future.

Not gonna lie, this recipe is a little kitchen intensive, but the results are outstanding. A lot of it is being patient with the onions and cooking low and slow for best results. That being said, I wouldn’t change a thing about the seasonings or the prep. Great pork chop recipe.
I made exactly as stated in the directions, kind of bland looked delicious. Maybe my taste buds have changed. I used bone in 1" pork chops, they were on the tough side.
Absolutely delicious! I didn't have any buttermilk, so googled how to make your own. I will make this again!
Easy, quick, and so delicious! This will part of my regular rotation. I used plain yogurt in place of buttermilk. It still was great.
I loved it but my hubby thought there were too many onions. I followed the recipe exactly. Possibly if I had chopped the onions they would have melted into the dish a little more.

Fabulous and easy. we've made it 3 time using different onions each time: yellow, Walla Walla, and Vidalia. the latter two sweet onions make for a very rich caramelized flavor, so if you'd prefer less sweet, use yellow onions. Also, we had better results with thicker (i.e.., 1") chops...thinner chops cook very quickly.
This recipe was so easy to make. The poultry seasoning made the dish and the caramelized onions were great. The chops were very moist.

I halved the recipe ( 2 chops, 1" thick) . Followed the recipe, except I added more onion, and used evaporated milk because I needed to use it up. All timings are pretty accurate! You DON'T want to over cook pork, they'll get dry. So make sure the last step the temperature is on low for 10 mins. Served a mashed potatoes and asparagus. Pretty good

We had pork chops in the freezer and an extra carton of mushrooms in the fridge so I figured what better time to make it. My family loved it! Made exactly as the recipe was written and served with mashed potatoes. Will definitely make this again because even my finicky granddaughter loved it.
A little time consuming but super good. I had boneless chops so seasoned them and soaked in buttermilk for several hours. Then used sour cream in place of the buttermilk when cooking.
I added already minced garlic, vegetable broth and I seasoned the chops with black pepper and steak and chop seasoning. Yes I would do it again.

Love love love these pork chops. Chops can be tough to pull off, being easy to dry out. Not these! I’ve made these maybe 4 times now just as written and every time they come out awesome! CJ once again you are the best!
Not a fan. Found the gravy to be flavourless. Won’t be using this recipe again.

I saw this recipe today and I made this dish tonight. I'm a one-person household and what I love about Chef John's recipes is that usually I can divide them in half and for me that is more than enough for a couple of meals. I browned the chops longer than five minutes per side because I wanted them really browned. This dish turned out beautifully served with rice and a green side salad. Perfection.
Tasty and gravy’s yummy too. I used mushroom ravioli under and/or rice. Pleased with this dish.
Added my Louisiana touch to it.

This is beyond delicious and every bit as easy as Chef John says it is! I used pork steaks and I didn't add the buttermilk as we don't have it readily available and I forgot to make some 30 minutes before I started cooking. 
I don't know if it changes the flavour at all for better or worse but this was scrumptious even without it. I served it with Chef John's mashed potatoes; a perfect combination and a perfect meal! 
This is definitely going to become a regular addition!
So simple and easy yet SOOOOOOO delicious! Best pork chop recipe ive ever tried.
This was delicious. I will be making this again!

What's not to love about delicious onions browned. One thought, many people don't keep buttermilk in the home, but do keep sour cream. I've learned to mix a few TBS of sour cream with a tad of the sauce to thin it out a little and not much different. . . always can find a close sub :-)
I absolutely love this recipe. The only changes I make is sometimes forgetting or adding different seasonings. This is so delicious I highly recommend this recipe.

I made this exactly as the recipe is written, except I used boneless pork chops. (They were about 2 inches thick.) The only other change was that I doubled the sauce. Oh! I used one yellow onion and one red onion. 

I did cook the onions over a low heat for probably 20 minutes... They were beautiful and delicious. Sadly, I should have used at least 4 large onions instead of two. There just wasn't enough for the sauce, in my opinion. The sauce was okay. I didn't think it was fantastic or anything, and I REALLY wanted to love this recipe. 

I won't ever make this recipe ever again. At least not for pork chops. I might make it for chicken at some point. I've got other pork chop recipes that are so much better than this one. I wish I hadn't of wasted my pork chops on this recipe.

Eh...it was okay. The sauce was a bit bland, and I had to add more salt, pepper and an extra sprinkle of poultry seasoning. It's not that it was bad, but I probably won't make it again. There are so many other recipes which are much more flavorful.

Oh my god this was delicious. I doubled the recipe. The pork chops come out so tender and juicy...child, ummmm, it was so good. That onion gravy is to die for.. I think I did die over how good it was.

I made garlic mashed potatoes and green beans with this.

Everyone loved it.

Chef John... pat your self on the back for this one.
My granddaughter loved the gravy so much, she could not help herself from dipping the crusty bread in it again and again.
Followed recipe; no changes. Absolutely delicious! I will definitely make it again!
Made this a few times. Mostly with chicken. It’s my go to recipe because it’s so easy and yummy!! Happy cooking. Made as is.
